text.p: Write a piece of Python code that, given the integer variable N, counts the number of positive divisors N has and prints the result. Remember to count 1 and N.
For example, if we define N to be 24, your code should print out the result: Number of divisors: 8 because 24 has 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24 as divisors.
Hint: The % operator is useful for this problem.

For problems such as these, do not include input statements or define the variables we give you. Our automated testing will provide values for you, so write your code in the following box assuming they are already defined.

p.b: During the actual exam, you will only see one or two test cases.
